results.title: [A clinical intervention study among 463 essential hypertensive patients with metabolic syndrome].
results.journal: Zhonghua Xin Xue Guan Bing Za Zhi
results.text_hl: Two of the three components (1) increased waist circumference and/or BMI; (2) increased @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglycerides@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@TG@@@) and/or decreased high-density lipoprotein cholesterol; (3) @DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@ (@DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@IGT@@@) were present define the @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@MS@@@. The three intervention therapy groups were: @CHEMICAL_Indapamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007190 @@@indapamide@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Fosinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017328 @@@fosinopril@@@ (I + F, n = 151); @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Nitrendipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009568 @@@nitrendipine@@@ (A + N, n = 160); @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Nitrendipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009568 @@@nitrendipine@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (A + N + M, n = 152).

citations.NLM: Guo JZ, Gong YC, Zhang JL, Qing YW, Dai QY, Wang YC, Gao X, Ni YF. [A clinical intervention study among 463 essential hypertensive patients with metabolic syndrome]. Zhonghua Xin Xue Guan Bing Za Zhi. 2005 Feb;33(2):132-6. PMID: 15924807

results.title: Impaired left ventricular filling dynamics in patients with angina and angiographically normal coronary arteries: effect of beta adrenergic blockade.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To assess exercise performance and @DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@resting left ventricular filling@@@ dynamics in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@syndrome X@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@SX@@@) in basal conditions and after 10 days treatment with oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

results.title: Cardiovascular protective effects of nebivolol in Zucker diabetic fatty rats.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: The present study provides substantial information supporting an actual protective role of @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ in comparison with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in experimental @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@.

results.title: [Effect of combined antihypertensive and lipid lowering therapy on the level of coronary risk and tissue insulin resistance in patients with metabolic syndrome].
results.text_hl: MATERIAL: Seventy five @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@ aged 40-59 years were included into an open study with parallel groups in which the following combinations of @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ lowering and antihypertensive drugs were used for sweeksinch: @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ (n=17, group 1); @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (n=17, group 2); @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (n=21, group 3), and @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Indapamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007190 @@@indapamide@@@ (n=20, group 4).

citations.NLM: Mamedov MN, Perova NV, Kosmatova OV, Khadipash LA, Kiseleva NV, Oganov RG. [Effect of combined antihypertensive and lipid lowering therapy on the level of coronary risk and tissue insulin resistance in patients with metabolic syndrome]. Kardiologiia. 2003;43(3):13-9. PMID: 12891253
citations.BibTeX: @article{12891253, title={[Effect of combined antihypertensive and lipid lowering therapy on the level of coronary risk and tissue insulin resistance in patients with metabolic syndrome].}, author={Mamedov MN and Perova NV and Kosmatova OV and Khadipash LA and Kiseleva NV and Oganov RG}, journal={Kardiologiia}, volume={43}, number={3}, pages={13-9}}

results.title: Are we misunderstanding beta-blockers.
results.text_hl: Conversely, in elderly @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensives@@@ first-line beta-blockade (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) has performed poorly in reducing cardiovascular risk (due to partial beta-2 blockade @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ evokes @<m>DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic disturbance@@@ and does not improve vascular compliance, or effectively lower central aortic pressure or reverse @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@).

citations.NLM: Cruickshank JM. Are we misunderstanding beta-blockers. Int J Cardiol. 2007 Aug 9;120(1):10-27. PMID: 17433471
citations.BibTeX: @article{17433471, title={Are we misunderstanding beta-blockers.}, author={Cruickshank JM}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={120}, number={1}, pages={10-27}}
